ratings.comment: If you need calc 2, try to take it with Patrick!!!! First off, he speaks perfect English which is huge for a hard class like calc 2. Also, he wants students to do well so he set the average to a high BC if not low B (the average tended to be terrible). Only negative was stupid last problem on HW, but that is minor. Take Him!

I liked Patrick. His last problems were very difficult and didn't always pertain to what we were doing but his tests weren't bad and the curve was generous. It was easy as far as Math 222 goes. I recommend him.
Awesome Professor! Eager to help students and see them do well in his class. He even makes lecture fun with his punny remarks and pop culture references.

Patrick is extremely intelligent and made lectures more interesting with humor. the course is overall a little challenging, but homework is graded by completion and there are very generous curves on all of the exams.
Great teacher. Explains everything very well and gives unique examples. You can tel that he actually cares about his students. Tests were pretty easy and had massive curves. I would recommend him.

Patrick seems to be a good guy but was far from my favorite teacher. He wasn't bad, but I wouldn't be particularly stoked to take another class with him. His explanations were often vague and abstract. All things considered, Calc 2 is really hard, but Patrick made it bearable. I did appreicate some of his jokes. If you need Calc 2, consider Patrick

Really a brilliant person, when you are in class things tend to make sense, but he teaches at a much higher level than necessary. I really enjoyed his class because he's a funny guy, and made lectures bearable.

Patrick seems like a very nice guy. He is a decent professor, which is basically as good as possible for a math professor. Lectures can be abstract, but that it expected in a college calc course. You can tell he really cares about his students and is very, very fair with grade distributions. I would recommend him for sure for that reason.
He was a great overall professor and very helpful in general.

Patrick teaches a harder class well and makes clear explanations. the problem that other students seem to be having is that they cannot follow explanations but this is because Patrick makes assumptions that students understand prior material well and skips over "trivial" sections in explanations. 8/10 would learn from him again

Very young and down to earth professor.  Cracks nerdy but funny jokes in class and is always ready to make time for students with his emails and office hours. Has clear, straightforward logic in lectures and assigns hw that is relevant and if done and studied will get you a good grade in the course.

A good class. You have to look at the material and review before the lecture, otherwise you might fall behind on some of the explanations that he gives. Much of it is 'hand-wavy', but he admits this. A funny guy, fair tests, and uses LaTeX for writing HW assignments and exams. Clear, understandable voice. I recommend overall. Looks pretty young.

Patrick doesn't refer to his own lecture notes when giving a lecture and as a result, makes 3-5 errors per class. This makes it almost impossible to follow what he's trying to tell you. He told us what to expect on the 1st midterm and what happened was the complete opposite. As a result, the class average was 20/60 points. I would get another prof.

A nice and friendly guy, but not the best at conveying material and sometimes doesn't explain things he wrongly assumes students already know. His tests are very difficult, but have decent curves. The homework is somewhat unfair, as half the points come from 2 or three very difficult challenge problems harder than anything that was taught.
Brilliant and funny, but somewhat lacking in communication skills.
Patrick is a funny guy and a pretty good professor. Hard homework, pretty tough exams, but 421 is a good intro to proof class. I would (and am!) taking a class taught by Patrick again.

Patrick is obviously brilliant, however he lacks the ability to effectively communicate ideas and concepts to the class. He has what is known as the "expert blindspot", where he is so brilliant that he forgets his students aren't on the same level as he is. While writing proofs he mostly just writes without explanation, and refers you to the book.

Somehow, I didn't like his teaching. Although, he was meticulous, there was something missing in his teaching. Specifically, he didn't give us the bigger picture and we were mostly lost in the details. HWs were tough but I think I learnt a lot from it. Hez quite capable of teaching well.. But,as of now average teaching!!
